comment.author: 49487626@N07
comment._content:
A data desta foto pode ser datada com maior precisão, consultando a obra "Os aviões da cruz de cristo" de  Mário Canongia Lopes e José Manuel R. Costa.
Nesta foto está retratados vários DC3 militares e bombardeiros Consolidated B-24 Liberator que fizeram aterragens de emergência em Portugal no decorrer da Operação Tocha - Invasão de Marrocos e Argélia em Novembro de 1943

comment.realname: Biblioteca de Arte / Art Library Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian
comment.author: 26577438@N06
37530958@N02
comment._content: Creio que estes DC3 e Liberators são aviões “civilizados”, destinados a voos de transporte da BOAC.

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Alpologies, I have to write in English. These are BOAC civilian registered aircraft, the date is believed to be approximately late October 1943. (Operation Torch Invasion of Morocco/Algeria was in November 1942). The DC-3 far left is G-AGBD of the regular BOAC/KLM airline service from Bristol (UK) to Lisbon,L-R the Dakotas are G-AGFX. , G-AGHS,G-AGFZ...L-R the Liberators are G-AGFR,G-AGFS, G-AGF?

comment.author: 7691137@N06
comment._content:
Extraordinary. How ever did you find this? My grandfather, Capt Ashley, flew G-AGFX, G-AGFZ, G-AGFO,  and G-AGFP which I think is the Liberator on the right of the photo. Well done. Impressive.
Steve.

comment.realname: Biblioteca de Arte / Art Library Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian
comment.author: 26577438@N06
comment._content:
Dear Stephen,
Thank's for your comment. These photos, as well as other in the album, are from one of the most important photographic studios in Lisbon (Portugal) in the 20th century. Name of the studio: Mario Novais.
We, at the Caloust Gulbenkian Foundation Art Library, have the collection of this studio that have been almost completly scanned.
Best

comment.author: 7691137@N06
comment._content:
This is an amazing archive. Many congratulations.
Best wishes,
Stephen
